result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Status conference on December 15, 2022 at 02:45 pm.

9:00 AM Cases called 22CM35, 22CF109 & 22CF874. Defendant James I Montroy appeared by video, in custody from the Eau Claire County Jail.  Attorney George E. Miller appeared by video for James I Montroy.  Attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. There is not an agreement at this time. 

Hearing: 12/15/22 at 2:45pm in person for 15min
Notice of Hearing for Competency hearing - mistakenly scheduled in case and parties notified of mistake
Status conference on October 24, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Cases called at 2:36 PM: 22CF109, 22CF874, 22CM35.
Defendant James I Montroy in court, in custody with Attorney George Miller.  Attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick in court for State of Wisconsin. 
22CF874: State calls Officer Philip Noland of the ECPD. He is sworn and testifies. Officer Noland identifies the Defendant in the Court room.
Cross Examination by Defense. Witness excused.  Court takes judicial notice of the bonds signed in 22CF109 and 22CM35.
State calls Investigator Lance Maske of the Eau Claire County Sheriff's Office. He is sworn and testifies. Cross Examination by Defense. Witness excused.
Court finds probable cause and binds the matter over. Branch 3 to schedule further proceedings.

(Cases 22CF109, 22CM35 are called at 1:32 PM) Defendant James I Montroy in court, in custody with Attorney Alicia Linzmeier. ADA Tiffany Winter appears in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
22CF109- State calls Detective Olivia Erl, Eau Claire Police Department, sworn and testifies. Detective Erl identifies the Defendant. Cross-examination of Detective Erl by Defense. Detective is excused. Defense objects to bind over as identification has not been met.  
Court finds probable cause and binds the matter over.  
Arraignment in 22CF109 and Hearing in 22CM35: 09/13/2022 at 9:30 AM.

Attorney Linzmeier advises the defendant is not appearing today and parties are jointly requesting to adjourn the prelim to a new date and time.
Preliminary Hearing scheduled for August 16, 2022 at 1:30 pm and case 22CM35 to ride along.
